title: The Upside-Down Blog
text:
The Kingdom of God is not what the world expects. It turns our assumptions upside-down and challenges our understanding of power, significance, and success. Where the world exalts the proud, Christ calls us to humility; where culture glorifies strength, the Gospel celebrates weakness. Jesus Christ Himself is the embodiment of this paradox, reigning as the King who was crucified, achieving victory through surrender, and offering life through His own death. In the upside-down Kingdom of God, the last are first, the least are greatest, and the humble are exalted. Here, light conquers darkness, life triumphs over death, and the cross, once a symbol of shame, becomes the cornerstone of hope and salvation. The Upside-Down Kingdom blog exists to explore and celebrate the profound and paradoxical truths that define God’s Kingdom. It seeks to invite readers to embrace the counterintuitive, countercultural ways of Jesus in a world that is ever desperate for meaning.

title: The Contra Blog
text: What if all of what we know or what we understand is actually an abstract? What if the real view is upside-down?

title: Dead and Dry
text:
Dead and Dry
“He is like a tree planted by streams of water that yields its fruit in its season, and its leaf does not wither.”

title: Life From Death
text:
Life From Death …
O death, where is your victory? O death, where is your sting? …

title: Covered Light
text:
Uncover the Light …
Because you don’t light up a candle and then hide it

title: Servants
text:
The Greatest in the Kingdom
Whoever would be great among you must be your servant, and whoever would be first among you must be your slave.
